page.title: 09Village shop/pub/hall
page.content: White Notley has a small Post Office and village stores. The shop is very important to the village because the nearest towns are several miles away. It is also a meeting place for people to chat. The shop has been sold twice in the past few years and the new owners are carrying out lots of renovation work. Some strange things have been found in the lathe and plaster walls. Just across the road is the village pub, the Cross Keys. Next to the pub is a small brick building with a curved brick roof. This is the old village lockup which dates from 1828. The first building in the village on the way from Braintree is the Village Hall. This is a modern building, about ten years old and is used for all sorts of meetings, dances and events by the village groups.
